study_title: COVID-19-Adaptive: A large-scale database of T-cell receptor beta (TCRb) sequences and binding associations from natural and synthetic exposure to SARS-CoV-2.
study_description: We describe the establishment and current content of the ImmuneCODE‚Ñ¢ database, which includes hundreds of millions of T-cell Receptor (TCR) sequences from over 1,400 subjects exposed to or infected with the SARSCoV-2 virus, as well as over 135,000 high-confidence SARS-CoV-2-specific TCRs.

biomaterial_provider: Adaptive Biotechnologies/Microsoft - immuneRACE and Antigen Map COVID19: immune response to COVID-19 (with Microsoft); cDNA or gDNA from T cells, B-cell depleted T cells, or PBMCs
library_generation_protocol: Immunosequencing of the CDR3 regions of human TCRŒ≤ chains was performed using the immunoSEQ Assay. Extracted genomic DNA was amplified in a bias-controlled multiplex PCR, followed by high-throughput sequencing. The Human-TCRB-PD4bx primer set was used.
software_versions: immunoSEQ Assay v4 (Adaptive Biotechnologies, Seattle, WA)
data_processing_protocols: TCRb analysis via the immunoSEQ Assay (Adaptive Biotechnologies, Seattle, WA).
